etymology.description: 木(木) (mù, "tree") with a horizontal line above -> top of the tree -> end
etymology.interpretation: The character 末(末) (mò, "end") uses the character 木(木) (mù, "tree") with a line at the top to convey the idea of the end or the uppermost part, showing the concept of conclusion or the utmost point.

examples.chinese: 当故事走到末(當故事走到末)，读者心中充满感慨(讀者心中充滿感慨)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng gùshì zǒu dào mò, dúzhě xīnzhōng chōngmǎn gǎnkǎi.
examples.english: When the story reached its end, the readers were filled with emotion.

examples.chinese: 比赛进入末(比賽進入末)，胜负难料(勝負難料)。
examples.english: The match entered its final stage, and the outcome was unpredictable.

examples.chinese: 他坚持到末(他堅持到末)。
examples.english: He persevered until the very end.
